question: Posted By Cyndi on July 16, 1997 at 03:57:18:In Reply to: lack of sensitivity posted by Ray Kopcinski on July 14, 1997 at 10:04:41:: I am a 51 year old male in good health. During the last six monthsI have noticed a dramatic decline in the ability to feel an orgasm.I have no problem getting or maintaining an erection, but there is nosensation associated with orgasmic release. My sex drive has also allbut disappeared. It seems as if my genital are is becoming totally de-sensitized. It is causing a problem for me and my wife and any informationyou could give would be extremely appreciated.Ray, I think you need to see your doctor and be checked for diabetes.  Myhusband has diabetes and his problem started this same way.  The feelingisn't there because of nerve damage.  The more damage that occurs, the lessfeeling there is.  I'm sure that there are other things that can cause thenerve damage but I know for a fact that diabetes does.  Been there, done that!!!Also, don't wait too long because if something can be done to help stop the progressionof nerve damage, you want to stop it.  My husbands has progressed beyond the nerve damageand he is unable to have an erection at all.  Urologist have tried meds, shots etc. but nothinghas helped him now so be sure to have it checked out before it is too late.
title: Re: lack of sensitivity
